name: Zane Bradley's Resume
body:
## Contact
---
Zane Bradley - [zane@mailoo.org](mailto:zane@mailoo.org)

## Goal
---
My goal is to obtain a work experience as a software developer.

## Work Experience
---
#### *Teacher*
TechLab Education - 12374 Saratoga Sunnyvale Rd, Saratoga, CA 95070, 408.837.0523
(June 8, 2014 to August 15, 2014 â€“ Full-Time)

At TechLab Education I taught computer programming classes over the summer to groups of kids ranging in age from 8-18 years, with class sizes ranging from 6-20 kids. I taught and prepared lesson plans for Python, Java, Web Design, Arduino and 3D Printing classes. I also taught Java and Python classes through TechLab at Ohlone College for Kids in Fremont. 

References: [keshav - owner](mailto:keshav@techlabeducation.com) and [kiyan - operations manager](mailto:kiyan@techlabeducation.com)


#### *Tutor* 
(August 2014 - Present) I tutor students at Saratoga High School in AP Computer Science

## Programming Experience
---

#### *Languages*
I am fluent in Python, Java, Javascript (plus HTML, CSS, JQuery, Markdown) and Bash. I am also semi-fluent in Haskell, Clojure, Common Lisp, Lua, and Ruby. I have experience with Linux, Windows and OSX. I use Linux for personal use.

#### *Examples*
I host all my projects good enough for the public on [github](http://github.com/zzggbb). This page itself is hosted here!

My teaching material files for the python classes that I taught can be found [here](https://github.com/zzggbb/work/tree/master/python/curriculum/advanced). Includes lessons on boolean logic, data structures, list comprehensions, builtin functions, recursion, and practice problems.

## Hobbies
---
In my free time I enjoy programming, building/repairing/collection computers, woodworking, furniture and cabinet making, drawing, and listening to music.

## Academic Honors
---
National Merit Commended Scholar

Accepted to UC Santa Cruz Fall 2015, majoring in Computer Science in the Baskin School of Engineering, & Oregon State University Fall 2015, majoring in Computer Science in the College of Engineering (choice undecided)

## Senior Year Courses
---
AP Calculus, AP Statistics, AP Physics 1, AP Physics 2, Principles of Engineering, US Gov and Econ, and English 12
